verbose_text: Ishikawa et al. [XREF_BIBR] in a study of 75 gastric cancer patients divided into two groups depending on the degree of malignancy of differentiated (32 males/11 females) and un differentiated (22 males/10 females) gastric cancer found that a reduced adiponectin level was associated with an increased risk for gastric cancer and it had a potential role in tumor progression, especially in undifferentiated type cancers in the upper stomach.
